'Backbone' is an album by the American rock band Backbone, a trio led by former
Grateful Dead drummer Bill Kreutzmann. Their only album, it was released by
Grateful Dead Records on January 13, 1998. It contains ten original songs, plus
a version of the Grateful Dead tune "New Speedway Boogie".

In addition to Kreutzmann, the band Backbone included guitarist Rick Barnett and
bassist Edd Cook. Their music was heavily influenced by blues
and R&B, and included substantial amounts of improvisational jamming.
categories: Blues rock albums by American artists
